name: Corpse Lunge
text:
As an additional cost to cast Corpse Lunge, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Corpse Lunge deals damage equal to the exiled card's power to target creature.

name: Corpse Traders
text: {2}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: Those without breath can't complain.
Those without breath can't complain.

name: Corpseweft
text: {1}{B}, Exile one or more creature cards from your graveyard: Create a tapped X/X black Zombie Horror creature token, where X is twice the number of cards exiled this way.

editions.flavor: Sidisi hated to limit her options.

name: Corpulent Corpse
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Suspend 5—{B} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {B} and exile it with five time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

name: Corrosion
text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a rust counter on each artifact target opponent controls. Then destroy each artifact with converted mana cost less than or equal to the number of rust counters on it. Artifacts destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
When Corrosion leaves the battlefield, remove all rust counters from all permanents.

name: Corrosive Gale
text:
({G/P} can be paid with either {G} or 2 life.)
Corrosive Gale deals X damage to each creature with flying.

editions.flavor:
"Wipe Sheoldred's spies from the sky. She'll see the result of our vision soon enough."
—Glissa

name: Corrosive Mentor
text: Black creatures you control have wither. (They deal damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

editions.flavor: Guttering cinders stoke their dying flames by snuffing out the lights of others.

name: Corrupt
text: Corrupt deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of Swamps you control. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic
editions.flavor: There are things beneath the murk for whom the bog is a stew, a thin broth in need of meat.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana
editions.flavor: There are things beneath the murk for whom the bog is a stew, a thin broth in need of meat.
One misstep in the swamp and the evil that sleeps beneath will rise to find you.
There are things beneath the murk for whom the bog is a stew, a thin broth in need of meat.
There are things beneath the murk for whom the bog is a stew, a thin broth in need of meat.
The power of the fens sleeps lightly, and always awakens hungry.
There are things beneath the murk for whom the bog is a stew, a thin broth in need of meat.
Yawgmoth brushed Urza's mind, and Urza's world convulsed.

name: Corrupt Court Official
text: When Corrupt Court Official enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.

name: Corrupted Conscience
text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature has infect. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

editions.flavor: Karn's creation is now his master.

name: Corrupted Crossroads
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool. ({C} represents colorless mana.)
{T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast a spell with devoid.

editions.flavor:
"Look, and see the future."
—Ayli, high priest of the Eternal Pilgrims

name: Corrupted Grafstone
text:
Corrupted Grafstone enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Choose a color of a card in your graveyard. Add one mana of that color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: It is all too easy to disturb the Blessed Sleep.

name: Corrupted Harvester
text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Corrupted Harvester.

editions.flavor:
"Before the blessed assault begins, we must seek specimens that are well-adapted to our way of . . . life."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Corrupted Resolve
text: Counter target spell if its controller is poisoned.

editions.flavor:
"Flesh is a sickness that infects Phyrexia."
—Avaricta, Gitaxian sective

name: Corrupted Roots
text:
Enchant Forest or Plains
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, its controller loses 2 life.

editions.flavor: The bones of Jund's dead resurfaced in Naya, poisoning the jungle and killing the sunseeders' crops.

name: Corrupted Zendikon
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a 3/3 black Ooze creature. It's still a land.
When enchanted land dies, return that card to its owner's hand.

name: Corrupt Eunuchs
text: When Corrupt Eunuchs enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.

name: Corrupting Licid
text:
{B}, {T}: Corrupting Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {B} to end this effect.
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

name: Corrupt Official
text:
{2}{B}: Regenerate Corrupt Official.
Whenever Corrupt Official becomes blocked, defending player discards a card at random.

editions.flavor: His favor comes at a high price.

name: Cosi's Ravager
text: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may have Cosi's Ravager deal 1 damage to target player.

editions.flavor:
"Cosi has many followers. Even the volcano finds a way to do his bidding."
—Zakken, Enclave cleric

"Cosi has many followers. Even the volcano finds a way to do his bidding."
—Zakken, Enclave cleric

name: Cosi's Trickster
text: Whenever an opponent shuffles his or her library, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Cosi's Trickster.

editions.flavor: She watches the chaos created by the Roil, seeking strength in the patterns of anarchy.

name: Cosmic Horror
text:
First strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy Cosmic Horror unless you pay {3}{B}{B}{B}. If Cosmic Horror is destroyed this way, it deals 7 damage to you.

editions.flavor: ". . . [S]creams of horror rend th' affrighted skies." —Alexander Pope, The Rape of the Lock

"Then flashed the living lightning from her eyes,/ And screams of horror rend th' affrighted skies."
—Alexander Pope, The Rape of the Lock

"Then flashed the living lightning from her eyes,/ And screams of horror rend th' affrighted skies."
—Alexander Pope, The Rape of the Lock

name: Cosmic Larva
text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Cosmic Larva unless you sacrifice two lands.

editions.flavor: For millennia they wandered from plane to plane, devouring all metal. Finally, their wanderings are over.

name: Council Guardian
text: Will of the council — When Council Guardian enters the battlefield, starting with you, each player votes for blue, black, red, or green. Council Guardian gains protection from each color with the most votes or tied for most votes.

name: Council of Advisors
text: When Council of Advisors enters the battlefield, draw a card.

editions.flavor: Sun Quan's long and successful rule in the years 199 to 251 was due to his ability to choose and foster talented advisors and generals.

name: Council of the Absolute
text:
As Council of the Absolute enters the battlefield, name a card other than a creature or land card.
Your opponents can't cast cards with the chosen name.
Spells with the chosen name you cast cost {2} less to cast.

name: Council's Judgment
text: Will of the council — Starting with you, each player votes for a nonland permanent you don't control. Exile each permanent with the most votes or tied for most votes.

editions.flavor: When its power is threatened, the council speaks with a unified voice.
When its power is threatened, the council speaks with a unified voice.

name: Counsel of the Soratami
text: Draw two cards.

editions.flavor: "Wisdom is not the counting of all the drops in a waterfall. Wisdom is learning why the water seeks the earth."
"Wisdom is not the counting of all the drops in a waterfall. Wisdom is learning why the water seeks the earth."
"Wisdom is not the counting of all the drops in a waterfall. Wisdom is learning why the water seeks the earth."

name: Counterbalance
text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may reveal the top card of your library. If you do, counter that spell if it has the same converted mana cost as the revealed card.

name: Counterbore
text: Counter target spell. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that spell and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Counterflux
text:
Counterflux can't be countered by spells or abilities.
Counter target spell you don't control.
Overload {1}{U}{U}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

name: Counterintelligence
text: Return one or two target creatures to their owners' hands.

editions.flavor: Before the battle of Red Cliffs, a supposedly sleeping Zhou Yu allowed his old friend, a Wei advisor, to steal a planted letter forged as if from Wei's two best admirals.

name: Counterlash
text: Counter target spell. You may cast a nonland card in your hand that shares a card type with that spell without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor: "Pathetic. Let me show you how it's done."

name: Countermand
text: Counter target spell. Its controller puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: The physical pain was nothing compared to the agony in his mind.

name: Counterspell
text: Counter target spell.

editions.flavor:
"It was probably a lousy spell in the first place."
—Ertai, wizard adept
The pyromancer summoned up her mightiest onslaught of fire and rage. Jace feigned interest.

"It was probably a lousy spell in the first place."
—Ertai, wizard adept

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Jace vs. Chandra
editions.flavor: The pyromancer summoned up her mightiest onslaught of fire and rage. Jace feigned interest.

"It was probably a lousy spell in the first place."
—Ertai, wizard adept

"Your attack has been rendered harmless. It is, however, quite pretty."
—Saprazzan vizier

"The duel was going badly for me, and Zur thought I was finished. He boasted that he would eat my soul—but all he ate were his words."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran royal mage

Kjeldoran Royal Mage

name: Countersquall
text: Counter target noncreature spell. Its controller loses 2 life.

editions.flavor: Each of the twenty-three winds of Esper is named and chronicled, and every possible interaction with the flow of magic is exhaustively detailed.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor:
"The essence of every world, every spell, and every thought is power. Nothing else matters, because nothing else exists."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Countless Gears Renegade
text: Revolt — When Countless Gears Renegade enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

editions.flavor: "Go forth and cause trouble, my little one!"

name: Countryside Crusher
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, put it into your graveyard and repeat this process.
Whenever a land card is put into your graveyard from anywhere, put a +1/+1 counter on Countryside Crusher.

name: Courageous Outrider
text: When Courageous Outrider enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal a Human card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

editions.flavor: One silvery blast signaled that she wouldn't be arriving at Thraben alone.

name: Courier Griffin
text:
Flying
When Courier Griffin enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: "Sea Gate has fallen. Survivors are on the move. Will send another griffin when we find refuge. Stay hidden. Stay safe."—Message from Tars Olan, kor world-gift

name: Courier Hawk
text: Flying, vigilance

editions.flavor: The Orzhov started using hawks as messengers in order to bypass the many toll roads and bridges that dot Ravnica. Soon the service became one of their most profitable businesses.
The Orzhov started using hawks as messengers in order to bypass the many toll roads and bridges that dot Ravnica. Soon the service became one of their most profitable businesses.

name: Courier's Capsule
text: {1}{U}, {T}, Sacrifice Courier's Capsule: Draw two cards.

editions.flavor: In ages past, Esper couriers bore messages written on ornate scrolls. The medium has grown more sophisticated, but the principle remains the same.

name: Courser of Kruphix
text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
You may play the top card of your library if it's a land card.
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.

name: Coursers' Accord
text: Create a 3/3 green Centaur creature token, then populate. (Create a token that's a copy of a creature token you control.)

editions.flavor: Bleak rumors reached Trostani's ears. She decreed that no one should travel alone.

name: Court Archers
text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: The Sun-Dappled Court of Valeron stands secure behind a wall of steel-tipped arrows.

name: Court Homunculus
text: Court Homunculus gets +1/+1 as long as you control another artifact.

editions.flavor: Mages of Esper measure their wealth and status by the number of servants in their retinues.
Mages of Esper measure their wealth and status by the number of servants in their retinues.
Mages of Esper measure their wealth and status by the number of servants in their retinues.

name: Court Hussar
text:
Vigilance
When Court Hussar enters the battlefield, look at the top three cards of your library, then put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
When Court Hussar enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless {W} was spent to cast it.

name: Courtly Provocateur
text:
{T}: Target creature attacks this turn if able.
{T}: Target creature blocks this turn if able.

editions.flavor: "My one regret is that I have mastered an art that leaves its audience unable to applaud."

name: Court Street Denizen
text: Whenever another white creature enters the battlefield under your control, tap target creature an opponent controls.

editions.flavor: "The Boros fight for justice. The Azorius fight for law. I hold the line between, and make sure the people are given both."
"The Boros fight for justice. The Azorius fight for law. I hold the line between, and make sure the people are given both."

name: Covenant of Blood
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Covenant of Blood deals 4 damage to target creature or player and you gain 4 life.

name: Covenant of Minds
text: Reveal the top three cards of your library. Target opponent may choose to put those cards into your hand. If he or she doesn't, put those cards into your graveyard and draw five cards.

editions.flavor: Before signing anything on Grixis, always read the fine print.
Before signing anything on Grixis, always read the fine print.

name: Cover of Darkness
text:
As Cover of Darkness enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Creatures of the chosen type have fear. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

name: Cover of Winter
text:
Cumulative upkeep {S} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it. {S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
If a creature would deal combat damage to you and/or one or more creatures you control, prevent X of that damage, where X is the number of age counters on Cover of Winter.
{S}: Put an age counter on Cover of Winter.

name: Covert Operative
text: Covert Operative can't be blocked.

editions.flavor: Some spies seek clarity. Others seek transparency.

name: Coveted Peacock
text:
Flying
Whenever Coveted Peacock attacks, you may goad target creature defending player controls. (Until your next turn, that creature attacks each combat if able and attacks a player other than you if able.)

name: Covetous Dragon
text:
Flying
When you control no artifacts, sacrifice Covetous Dragon.

editions.flavor: Gatha survived as long as he did by giving all Keld's predators exactly what they wanted.

name: Cowardice
text: Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, return that creature to its owner's hand. (It won't be affected by the spell or ability.)

editions.flavor: Gerrard was the Mercadian soldiers' greatest hero; they followed him blindly. When he left, they stumbled around blindly.

name: Cowed by Wisdom
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your hand.

name: Cower in Fear
text: Creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"You will fully understand fear when you discover it is the final thing you put your faith in."
—Nicol Bolas
Consulate guards who pursue fleeing renegades into the Cowl often become lost—occasionally permanently—in the city's wildest greenbelt.

name: Crabapple Cohort
text: Crabapple Cohort gets +1/+1 as long as you control another green creature.

editions.flavor: Seven wives made seven pies from seven apples, each plucked from its branches. Now bare and bitter, it comes to exact its price: one apple, one bone.

name: Crab Umbra
text:
Enchant creature
{2}{U}: Untap enchanted creature.
Totem armor (If enchanted creature would be destroyed, instead remove all damage from it and destroy this Aura.)

name: Crackdown
text: Nonwhite creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

editions.flavor:
"There is no place for mercy in defense of our lives."
—Ta-Spon, Cho-Arrim executioner

name: Crackdown Construct
text: Whenever you activate an ability of an artifact or creature that isn't a mana ability, Crackdown Construct gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"All buildings are subject to search. Resistance will be punished."
—Enforcer-Chief Ranaj

name: Crackleburr
text:
{U/R}{U/R}, {T}, Tap two untapped red creatures you control: Crackleburr deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
{U/R}{U/R}, {Q}, Untap two tapped blue creatures you control: Return target creature to its owner's hand. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

name: Crackling Club
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0.
Sacrifice Crackling Club: Crackling Club deals 1 damage to target creature.

editions.flavor: It adds injury to injury.

name: Crackling Doom
text: Crackling Doom deals 2 damage to each opponent. Each opponent sacrifices a creature with the greatest power among creatures he or she controls.

editions.flavor: Do not fear the lightning. Fear the one it obeys.
Do not fear the lightning. Fear the one it obeys.
Do not fear the lightning. Fear the one it obeys.

name: Crackling Perimeter
text: Tap an untapped Gate you control: Crackling Perimeter deals 1 damage to each opponent.

editions.flavor: As the path he sought came into focus, Niv-Mizzet took steps to prevent others from approaching it.

name: Crackling Triton
text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice Crackling Triton: Crackling Triton deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: He calls upon both the currents in the sea and the current in the clouds.

name: Crack the Earth
text: Each player sacrifices a permanent.

editions.flavor:
"As the war progressed, the destruction the kami caused became more widespread and less predictable."
—Observations of the Kami War

name: Cradle Guard
text:
Trample
Echo {1}{G}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

editions.flavor:
Mother, sleep / Dream our lives
Our roots your soul / Our leaves your bed.

name: Cradle of Vitality
text: Whenever you gain life, you may pay {1}{W}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature for each 1 life you gained.

editions.flavor: Naya's trees grow tall and sturdy. Their foliage intertwines to form dewcups, rainwater pools where the elves gather to celebrate life.
Naya's trees grow tall and sturdy. Their foliage intertwines to form dewcups, rainwater pools where the elves gather to celebrate life.

name: Cradle to Grave
text: Destroy target nonblack creature that entered the battlefield this turn.

editions.flavor:
"As the fell soil's appetite grows, it gulps down passersby upon their first footfall."
—Ezrith, druid of the Dark Hours

name: Crafty Pathmage
text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor:
Follow the pathmage
—Otarian expression meaning
"escape quickly"
The most valuable commodity in the pits is a way out.

Follow the pathmage
—Otarian expression meaning
"escape quickly"

name: Cragganwick Cremator
text: When Cragganwick Cremator enters the battlefield, discard a card at random. If you discard a creature card this way, Cragganwick Cremator deals damage equal to that card's power to target player.

editions.flavor: Each night that his bowl fills, a village mourns.

name: Crag Puca
text: {U/R}: Switch Crag Puca's power and toughness until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Be happy when you see a puca shaped like mischief. It's far better than one shaped like death."
—Dindun of Kulrath Mine

name: Crag Saurian
text: Whenever a source deals damage to Crag Saurian, that source's controller gains control of Crag Saurian.

editions.flavor: It follows the strongest leader—the one with the longest whip.

name: Cranial Archive
text: {2}, Exile Cranial Archive: Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library. Draw a card.

editions.flavor: The greatest idea the zombie ever had in its head wasn't even its own.

name: Cranial Extraction
text: Name a nonland card. Search target player's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with that name and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Cranial Plating
Crash
text:
You may sacrifice a Mountain rather than pay Crash's mana cost.
Destroy target artifact.

editions.flavor: Gerrard shook his head as the ground rushed to meet him. "This," he thought, "is not the start I was hoping for."

name: Crashing Boars
text: Whenever Crashing Boars attacks, defending player chooses an untapped creature he or she controls. That creature blocks Crashing Boars this turn if able.

editions.flavor: Bores ruin a party. Boars are party to ruin.

name: Crashing Centaur
text:
{G}, Discard a card: Crashing Centaur gains trample until end of turn.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Crashing Centaur gets +2/+2 and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

name: Crash Landing
text: Target creature with flying loses flying until end of turn. Crash Landing deals damage to that creature equal to the number of Forests you control.

editions.flavor:
"The other guilds think they're untouchable. It's time we brought them back down to earth."
—Ghut Rak, Gruul guildmage

name: Crash of Rhinos
text: Trample

editions.flavor:
Love is like a rhino, short-sighted and hasty; if it cannot find a way, it will make a way.
—Femeref adage

Haste

text: No more than two creatures can attack you each combat.

editions.flavor: The goblins did not understand their attraction to the mana rig. They simply knew it was where they belonged.

name: Crazed Armodon
text: {G}: Crazed Armodon gets +3/+0 and gains trample until end of turn. Destroy Crazed Armodon at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only once each turn.

editions.flavor: These are its last days. Mourning is over. Rage remains.

name: Crazed Firecat
text: When Crazed Firecat enters the battlefield, flip a coin until you lose a flip. Put a +1/+1 counter on Crazed Firecat for each flip you win.

editions.flavor:
"The longer it's caged, the madder it gets."
—Firecat handler

name: Crazed Goblin
text: Crazed Goblin attacks each turn if able.

editions.flavor: Because fighting is easier than figuring out what else to do.
